text: Considered expensive for a small serving. Obviously some items are prepared ahead and mix upon ordered instead of prepared in whole, given this is a dessert shop and not hawker stall. Tried the sago and is the same like those from a hawker stall. Was expecting of better quality but the melon was hard and not sweet though the coconut milk was very sweet.
Absolutely delicious dessert, especially the guiling gao. The place is clean, service is prompt. Overall a good place to indulge after a night out in Geylang

Desserts are sub-par, seems to be pre-prepared and reheated, served in plastic container, factory made, mass-produced. Yam paste was runny, not much substance. Milk pudding not smooth consistency, taste was OK. Almond sesame paste is decent.

Not too bad. Peanut paste was nice and the steamed fresh milk pudding tasted abit like icecream haha. Price wise quite ex. Totall for both 10 dollars but i had cravings for dessert at midnight so this shall do.

Refreshing and cool taste, perfect after a hot day.
Ordered 芒果水果龟苓膏 Mango Gui Ling Gao and 杨之甘露 Mango Sago.
Non air con environment, there are fans but it feels a little warm. It should be noted that prices are on the higher side.
